item.title: XO Offering Ethernet to the World
item.description:
Global telecommunications companies now have a unique opportunity: access to 4 million commercial buildings across the U.S. for offering Ethernet services. This is made possible by XO Communications’ new Ethernet Hub service. While this might seem irrelevant to businesses unless they’re looking to cut costs on voice and data services, the potential savings hidden within XO’s recent press release are significant. XO Communications is a competitive carrier, meaning they weren’t part of the traditional Bell Telephone system...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/xo-offering-ethernet-to-the-world/

item.title: Thirty Carriers, No Waiting
item.description:
Are you overwhelmed and frustrated with your current telecommunications services? Do you feel stuck with your local phone or internet provider and dread seeing your monthly bill? You don’t have to endure this! You deserve a wide range of choices for your voice and data communication needs. Imagine having access to 30 different business-grade carriers, offering everything from basic phone lines to high-speed internet options like wireless and satellite. Whether you need ISDN PRI lines for your office phone system, MPLS networks to connect multiple locations, or Gigabit Ethernet for high-bandwidth applications like video conferencing, you have options...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/thirty-carriers-no-waiting/

item.title: Managed Security Moves To The Cloud
item.description:
Cloud services are expanding beyond the familiar Infrastructure, Platform, and Software as a Service to include Security as a Service. Integra, for example, now offers a suite of Cloud Security Services, including a Cloud Firewall Service. Many companies find managed security appealing because it removes the need for dedicated IT staff or investments in security hardware. Traditionally, this involved a monthly service fee and an on-premises security device. Cloud-based security takes it further, eliminating the need for physical hardware altogether...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/managed-security-moves-to-the-cloud/

item.title: How Telarus GeoScan Finds Better Network Deals
item.description:
Telarus, a leading telecom brokerage service, introduces GeoScan, an innovative telecom carrier research tool, to enhance its suite of software-based services. This new tool allows Telarus consultants to refine carrier service offerings for clients through a more efficient search and evaluation process. By pinpointing the closest matching offers, Telarus agents can better serve their client’s specific needs. GeoScan addresses the need to manage a rapidly expanding pool of carrier options. Telarus’ existing GeoQuote process, known for finding and organizing services from various carriers, faced a welcome challenge: increased carrier participation and a transforming telecom landscape...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/how-telarus-geoscan-finds-better-network-deals/

item.title: Why Colocate To An Omaha Data Center
item.description:
While major corporations might associate colocation data centers with locations like 60 Hudson St in New York City or One Wilshire in Los Angeles, Omaha, Nebraska, presents a compelling alternative. Beyond being home to Warren Buffett and Berkshire Hathaway, Omaha boasts a robust business environment, earning recognition from Forbes magazine as the nation’s top “Best-Bang-For-The-Buck City.” Crucially, Omaha houses the Scott Data Center complex. The Scott Data Center offers over 110,000 square feet of data storage, boasting continuous operation since 2006...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/why-colocate-to-an-omaha-data-center/
